intro: Chrysanthemum adustum, commonly known as the Japanese chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with ray and disc florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soil and full sun. It is widely cultivated for ornamental purposes and has a long history in traditional medicine. Chrysanthemum adustum is also known for its ability to thrive in temperate climates and its resilience to various environmental conditions.
